item.title: Windows Is Lying To You… With DPI Virtualization

item.description:
Windows lies, and Kevin cries, because his apps are blurry...

item.title: SET PROCEDURE TO MyDll
item.dc:creator: Kevin Ragsdale
item.description:
I use the Microsoft Web Browser Control as the primary UI for an app. This means I need a ton of support files like cascading stylesheets, javascript files, images, etc. Typically, I create a subfolder in the Windows “Temp” (SYS(2023)) folder for the HTML files, then subfolders for each of the support file types (CSS, […]

The post SET PROCEDURE TO MyDll appeared first on Kevin Ragsdale.

item.title: I’ve Seen This Before. It’s An Outlier.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Ragsdale
item.description:
UPDATE: Finally figured out this issue. I was encrypting an XML file, which caused some illegal characters to appear from time to time (the “outlier” instances). Took out the header of the XML file, and everything works as expected. I recently added some functionality to an app which allows the app to login to a […]

The post I’ve Seen This Before. It’s An Outlier. appeared first on Kevin Ragsdale.

item.title: If You Write Visual FoxPro Apps…
item.dc:creator: Kevin Ragsdale
item.description:
If you’re a Visual FoxPro developer, and you like to install the VFP runtime files in the WindowsSystem32 folder, Please… STOP. /dll-hell-rears-its-ugly-head

The post If You Write Visual FoxPro Apps… appeared first on Kevin Ragsdale.
